custom_item_1.description: Windows Compliance Policy - Require a password to unlock mobile devices
custom_item_1.info: This control determines whether a password is required before allowing access to the device via the touch screen.
custom_item_1.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance policy. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Require a password to unlock mobile devices' is set to 'Require'.

custom_item_2.description: Windows Compliance Policy - Required password type
custom_item_2.info: This control determines whether alphanumeric passcode is required.
custom_item_2.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance profile. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Required Password Type' is set to 'Alphanumeric'.

custom_item_3.description: Windows Compliance Policy - Maximum minutes of inactivity before password is required
custom_item_3.info: This control determines the amount of idle time before the screen will lock and reentry of the passcode is required.
custom_item_3.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance profile. Under 'System Security' verify that the 'Maximum Minutes of Inactivity Before Password is Required' is set to 5 or less.

custom_item_4.info: This control determines the maximum age of a password.
custom_item_4.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance profile. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Number of Days Until Password expires' is set to 90 or less.

custom_item_5.description: Windows Compliance Policy - Minimum password length
custom_item_5.info: This control determines whether a minimum length password is required. It is recommended that a passcode of 5 or more be set.
custom_item_5.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance profile. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Minimum Password Length' is configured correctly.

custom_item_6.description: Windows Compliance Policy - Number of previous passwords to prevent reuse
custom_item_6.info: This control determines the number of allowed previous passwords.
custom_item_6.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance profile. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Number of previous passwords to prevent reuse' is configured to 5 or more.

custom_item_7.description: Windows Compliance Policy - Encryption of data storage on device
custom_item_7.info: This control determines whether encryption is required on the device.
custom_item_7.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance profile. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Encryption of data storage on device' is set to 'Require'.
custom_item_7.regex: Encryption of data storage on device:
custom_item_7.expect: Encryption of data storage on device: true

custom_item_8.description: Windows Compliance Policy - Block USB debugging on device
custom_item_8.info: This control determines whether use of USB Debugging is allowed.
custom_item_8.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance profile. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Block USB debugging on device' is set to 'Block'.
custom_item_8.expect: Block USB debugging on device: true

custom_item_9.info: This control determines whether the camera is allowed.
custom_item_9.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'General' verify that 'Camera' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_10.info: This control determines whether a password is required before allowing access to the device via the touch screen.
custom_item_10.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration policy. Under 'Password' verify that 'Password' is set to 'Require'.

custom_item_11.description: Windows Device Configuration - Maximum minutes of inactivity until screen locks
custom_item_11.info: This control determines the amount of idle time before the screen will lock and reentry of the passcode is required.
custom_item_11.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Password' verify that the 'Maximum minutes of inactivity until screen locks' is set to 5 or less.

custom_item_12.info: This control determines the maximum age of a password.
custom_item_12.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Password' verify that 'Password expiration (days)' is set to 90 or less.

custom_item_13.description: Windows Device Configuration - Required password type
custom_item_13.info: This control determines whether alphanumeric passcode is required.
custom_item_13.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Password' verify that 'Required Password Type' is set to 'At least alphanumeric with symbols'.

custom_item_14.info: This control determines whether NFC is allowed.
custom_item_14.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Cellular and connectivity' verify that 'NFC' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_15.info: This control determines whether Pop-Ups are allowed.
custom_item_15.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Microsoft Edge Browser' verify that 'Allow pop-ups' is set to 'No'.

custom_item_16.info: This control determines whether autofill is allowed.
custom_item_16.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Microsoft Edge Browser' verify that 'Allow Autofill in forms' is set to 'No'.

custom_item_17.info: This control determines whether removable storage is allowed.
custom_item_17.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'General' verify that 'Removable storage' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_18.description: Windows Device Configuration - OneDrive file sync
custom_item_18.info: This control determines whether OneDrive file sync is allowed.
custom_item_18.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'General' verify that 'OneDrive file sync' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_19.info: This control determines whether Geolocation is allowed.
custom_item_19.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'General' verify that 'Geolocation' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_20.info: This control determines whether Internet sharing is allowed.
custom_item_20.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'General' verify that 'Internet sharing' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_21.info: This control determines whether USB connection is allowed.
custom_item_21.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'General' verify that 'USB connection' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_22.description: Windows Device Configuration - Device name modification
custom_item_22.info: This control determines whether Device name modification is allowed.
custom_item_22.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'General' verify that 'Device name modification' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_23.info: This control determines whether Device discovery is allowed.
custom_item_23.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'General' verify that 'Device discovery' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_24.description: Windows Device Configuration - Network Inspection System
custom_item_24.info: This control determines whether Network Inspection System is allowed.
custom_item_24.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Microsoft Defender Antivirus' verify that 'Network Inspection System' is set to 'Enable'.

custom_item_25.info: This control determines whether Behavior monitoring is allowed.
custom_item_25.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Microsoft Defender Antivirus' verify that 'Behavior monitoring' is set to 'Enable'.

custom_item_26.info: This control determines whether Real-time monitoring is allowed.
custom_item_26.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Microsoft Defender Antivirus' verify that 'Real-time monitoring' is set to 'Enable'.

custom_item_27.description: Windows Device Configuration - Scan all downloads
custom_item_27.info: This control determines whether Scan all downloads is allowed.
custom_item_27.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Microsoft Defender Antivirus' verify that 'Scan all downloads' is set to 'Enable'.

custom_item_28.description: Windows Device Configuration - Scan scripts loaded in Microsoft web browsers
custom_item_28.info: This control determines whether Scan scripts loaded in Microsoft web browsers is allowed.
custom_item_28.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Microsoft Defender Antivirus' verify that 'Scan scripts loaded in Microsoft web browsers' is set to 'Enable'.
custom_item_28.regex: Enable Scan scripts loaded in Microsoft web browsers:
custom_item_28.expect: Enable Scan scripts loaded in Microsoft web browsers: true

custom_item_29.description: Windows Device Configuration - End-user access to Defender
custom_item_29.info: This control determines whether End-user access to Defender is allowed.
custom_item_29.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Microsoft Defender Antivirus' verify that 'End-user access to Defender' is set to 'Block'.
custom_item_29.expect: Block End-user access to Defender: true

custom_item_30.description: Windows Device Configuration - Monitor file and program activity
custom_item_30.info: This control determines whether Monitor file and program activity is allowed.
custom_item_30.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Microsoft Defender Antivirus' verify that 'Monitor file and program activity' is set to 'Monitor all files'.
custom_item_30.expect: Monitor file and program activity: monitorAllFiles

custom_item_31.description: Windows Device Configuration - Scan archive file
custom_item_31.info: This control determines whether Scan archive file is allowed.
custom_item_31.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Microsoft Defender Antivirus' verify that 'Scan archive file' is set to 'Enable'.

custom_item_32.description: Windows Device Configuration - Scan incoming mail messages
custom_item_32.info: This control determines whether Scan incoming mail messages is allowed.
custom_item_32.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Microsoft Defender Antivirus' verify that 'Scan incoming mail messages' is set to 'Enable'.
custom_item_32.expect: Enable Scan incoming mail messages: true

custom_item_33.info: This control determines whether Cloud-delivered protection is allowed.
custom_item_33.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Microsoft Defender Antivirus' verify that 'Cloud-delivered protection' is set to 'Enable'.

custom_item_34.description: Windows Device Configuration - File Blocking Level
custom_item_34.info: This control determines whether File Blocking Level is set to High.
custom_item_34.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Microsoft Defender Antivirus' verify that 'File Blocking Level' is set to 'High'.

custom_item_35.info: This control determines whether Screen timeout is allowed.
custom_item_35.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Locked Screen Experience' verify that 'Screen timeout' is set to is set to 60 or less.

custom_item_36.info: This control determines whether System is allowed.
custom_item_36.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Control Panel and Settings' verify that 'System' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_37.info: This control determines whether Devices is allowed.
custom_item_37.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Control Panel and Settings' verify that 'Devices' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_38.description: Windows Device Configuration - Network and Internet
custom_item_38.info: This control determines whether Network and Internet is allowed.
custom_item_38.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Control Panel and Settings' verify that 'Network and Internet' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_39.info: This control determines whether Personalization is allowed.
custom_item_39.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Control Panel and Settings' verify that 'Personalization' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_40.info: This control determines whether Accounts is allowed.
custom_item_40.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Control Panel and Settings' verify that 'Accounts' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_41.description: Windows Device Configuration - Time and Language
custom_item_41.info: This control determines whether Time and Language is allowed.
custom_item_41.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Control Panel and Settings' verify that 'Time and Language' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_42.info: This control determines whether Gaming is allowed.
custom_item_42.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Control Panel and Settings' verify that 'Gaming' is set to 'Block'.
